page.title: 19CAPENHURST-CHANGE SINCE 1945
page.content: During World War Two milking parlours & mechanisation were introduced to local farms.This trend has continued resulting in a decreasing workforce. Pre-war farms made cheese to conserve summer milk for winter consumption. The Milk Marketting Board & bulk collection stopped this practice.Now farmhouse Cheshire is making a come- back.After the war some large farms were divided into smallholdings.This trend is being reversed with 5 farms currently amalgamating.In 1957 they employed 13 workers but will now only need 5.In the last 5 years new systems of drainage,hedge removal,pit filling & tree clearance have increased field size allowing land to carry more stock & crops.Even though housing continues to spread out from Ellesmere Port & a new motorway starts in the area it remains basically rural.
